briefdescription.para: Helper to handle Firestore errors consistently.

detaileddescription.para:
e
The error object caught from a try-catch block.
{ApiResponse<any>} An error response object.
Helper to convert Firestore dates (Timestamps) to ISO strings.
Ensures that all date fields in the document are returned as ISO 8601 strings instead of Firestore Timestamp objects, making them serializable for the frontend.

@template T The expected return type.
docSnap
The Firestore document snapshot data.
{T} The formatted data object.
Helper to get a reference to a user-specific collection.
Ensures all data is namespaced under users/{uid}/{collectionName}. Throws an error if the user is not authenticated.

briefdescription.para: Helper to get a reference to a specific document within a user's collection.
Helper to remove undefined fields from payload.

detaileddescription.para: Firestore rejects undefined values, so this function strips them out by serializing and deserializing via JSON.

@template T Type of the payload.
payload
The object to sanitize.
{T} The sanitized object.
Helper to generate a deterministic session ID.

date
The date string (YYYY-MM-DD).
time
The time string (HH:mm).
identifier
A unique identifier (e.g., location name).
{string} The generated session ID.
Payload for creating or updating an Indoor Session.
Indoor Session object as returned from the API.
Create a new Indoor Climbing Session.

simplesect.para: {Promise<{ ok: boolean; id?: string; error?: string }>}

briefdescription.para: Main API service for interacting with Firebase Firestore.

detaileddescription.para:
This module handles all CRUD operations for the application's data models:
Indoor Climbs
Outdoor Climbs
Fingerboarding
Competitions
Gym Sessions
It provides a standardized response wrapper and manages user-specific collections.
